title: Mass Allocate
content:
• Home
  • ››Manhattan Active® Omni
  • ››Order Management

  • ››Order Fulfillment
  • ››Order Allocation
  • ››Mass Allocate

Mass Allocate

Previous I Next

 

  • Order Processing: Mass Action
    • Mass Action Request
    • Mass Action
    • Mass Action Response

Order Processing: Mass Action

Order(s) that were previously not allocated due to technical failures can be processed for allocation again. A new API is exposed to reprocess the allocation, for the list of orders filtered based on the request query. The allocation process is triggered and the orders are processed asynchronously. 

Mass Action Request

Mass Action Request can be initiated via calling the API directly or through Adhoc request from Order List UI

  • On the Order List UI, filter the orders by applying search criteria and click the 'Allocate All' button
    • Prerequisite for the button enablement - 
      • Mandatory search criteria
      • Orders should be filtered based on search criteria
    • User should have required permission else hard check error is thrown on click of the button. Refer here for permission detail. 
  • Call the API directly: Use the following API,

    • <url>/order/api/order/order/massAction - POST method to mass allocate order(s). Prerequisite for the API to accept the request is to have the permission api::order::transaction::admin.

Mass Allocate sample request

{

"Query": "((MaxFulfillmentStatusId=1500 AND MinFulfillmentStatusId=1500) OR (MaxFulfillmentStatusId=1000 AND MinFulfillmentStatusId=1000) OR (MaxFulfillmentStatusId=1500 AND MinFulfillmentStatusId<1500) OR (MaxFulfillmentStatusId=2000 AND MinFulfillmentStatusId<2000) OR (MaxFulfillmentStatusId=3000 AND MinFulfillmentStatusId<3000))",

"MassAction" : "Allocate"

}

If a previous mass allocation job is "InProgress" then additional requests for mass action is rejected. The current job should complete successfully or should be aborted to accept any further request.

Abort Order Mass Action Job

URL - "/scheduler/api/scheduler/jobExecution/uniqueJobId/{uniqueJobId}"
Body Request - 
{
    "Status": "aborted"
}

Mass Action

Mass Action "Allocate" processing is similar to batch allocation refer here on batch allocation for more details.

Mass Action Response

Once the request is accepted, the API initiates the allocation service and provides the end user with a Job Schedule Id in the response.

Mass Allocate sample response

{
"success": true,
"header": null,
"data": {
"Messages": null,
"MassAction": "Allocate",
"JobScheduleId": "js95391076296076581202358"
},
"messageKey": null,
"message": "Order Mass Action Request Received",
"errors": [],
"exceptions": [],
"messages": {
"Message": [],
"Size": 0
},
"rootCause": null,
"requestUri": null,
"statusCode": "OK"
}

The status of a job can be monitored based on the Job Schedule Id either by calling the below API or navigating through MUP Monitor Scheduled Jobs UI and filtering the job list with the Job Scheduled Id.

Order Mass Action Job Status sample request

{{url}}/scheduler/api/scheduler/jobExecution/search

Body Request -
{
"Query": "JobTypeId=orderMassActionJob",
"Sort": [{"attribute": "CreatedTimestamp","direction": "desc"}]
}
Body Request -
{
"Query": "JobScheduleId=js95391076296076581202359",
"Sort": [{"attribute": "CreatedTimestamp","direction": "desc"}]
}

If the Job is success, but the order(s) are not allocated then enable below functional logs to trouble shoot allocation failure or verify troubleshoot UI to find out why order was not allocated.

Enable Functional Logs for Allocate Troubleshooting

{{url}}/order/component/logLevel

Body Request -

{

"loggerName":"com.manh.cp.app.logging.logger.allocation.OrderAllocationLogger",

"logLevel":"TRACE"

}
